text: Meiji Hashimoto (橋本明治, Hashimoto Meiji) (1904-1991) was a Japanese Nihonga painter and designer. He received a commission to paint a piece for the new Tokyo Imperial Palace. The piece titled “Sakura (cherry)” is a large painting measuring 2.74x2.5 metres. It is located on the cedar door of the east corridor of the Seiden hall.http://www.kunaicho.go.jp/e-about/shisetsu/kyuden- ph.html Opposite of it on the other side is “Kaede (maples)” by Hōshun Yamaguchi. == See also == * Seison Maeda (1885–1977), one of the leading Nihonga painters * List of Nihonga painters == References == Category:1904 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Japanese painters Category:Buddhist artists Category:Recipients of the Order of Culture Category:People from Shimane Prefecture
